South Abbotsford Fort St. John Kamloops Kelowna Prince George Richmond Victoria Moose Jaw Prince Albert Regina - Eastgate Regina - Grasslands Saskatoon - South Saskatoon - West Winnipeg Barrie Kitchener London Mississauga Oshawa Windsor Confirm About us Be The Place That People Want to Be. When you come to The Canadian Brewhouse, you‚Äôll feel like you‚Äôre right at home, because Our House is Your House‚Ä¶only we have way more TVs! That‚Äôs right, you won‚Äôt find a better selection of screens for watching the sports you love anywhere else! We even provide tabletop speakers for those nights when multiple sports and teams are playing.‚Äã Founder: Roger Newton How it all happened... 2002 An Edmonton boys' dream turned reality.  Roger Newton purchased an old pool hall in the west end of Edmonton, with a clear vision of what was missing from the city of champions.  There were Irish Bars, English Pubs, and even Belgian Cafes, but there was nothing that truly honoured the rich heritage of Canada.  Combine that with his love of Sports, Roger opened the first ever Canadiana Sports Bar in West Edmonton, The Canadian Brewhouse.  This location has since closed, but it was the start of a service industry giant. 2007 It takes time, passion, and persistence in order to grow a single restaurant into a nationally recognized brand.  In 2007, The Canadian Brewhouse leadership realized that they had the opportunity to do just that.  They took over another bar in North Edmonton and worked tirelessly to renovate it and turn it into a Canadian Brewhouse in just 30 days. 2009 In anticipation of the pending growth in South Edmonton and the expansion of Anthony Henday Drive, CBH opened up store number 3.  This was the first CBH designed and built-out from the ground up.  You can still see some of the same concepts and features in our newest locations as you can here, such as large vaulted ceilings, a second floor, and a jumbo score clock overtop of the main bar. 2010 Our first foray into a market that wasn't Edmonton.  Granted, Sherwood Park is like Edmonton's super cool neighbour who always brings beers to a barbecue.  This location has been the go-to sports bar in Sherwood Park ever since we opened our doors.  Here, we recently underwent a renovation to add another 100+ seats to accommodate the massive amounts of local sports teams who host fundraisers and team events at the location. 2011 Grande Prairie opens up to an excited city ready to watch some sports! 2012 This was the year we really started to take off and opened up 4 stores around Alberta! Downtown Edmonton, Camrose, Lloydminster, and Spruce Grove all opened up in the same year. 2013 Red Deer and Calgary Harvest Hills opened their doors. 2014 Leduc, Fort McMurray, and Saskatoon opened their doors. 2015 Airdrie, Okotoks, Regina Grasslands, Kelowna, and Fort Saskatchewan all opened their doors this year. 2016 Winnipeg, Regina Eastgate, Abbotsford and Moose Jaw all opened. 2017 Cochrane, Prince George, Fort St. John, Richmond, Calgary Mahogany, Chestermere and St. Albert South all opened their doors. 2018 St. Albert Jensen Lakes and Edmonton Lewis Estates opened their doors. 2019 Calgary Northgate, Saskatoon West and Edmonton Windermere opened. 2020 One of our most anticipated locations opened its doors in Lethbridge in 2020. This Brewhouse is the first one to feature something no other Brewhouse has ever had before; a full-sized bowling alley in the basement! That means you can choose from bowling in the basement, restaurant/bar on the main level, and rooftop patio! 2021 Our newest location in the Edmonton International Airport was cleared for takeoff, featuring pre and post-security seating! We also took a huge leap into the Ontario market with new locations in Oshawa and Barrie. Finally, we opened our 7th Edmonton location in Manning and our 5th location in Calgary in the Township district. 2022 More brand-spankin‚Äô new locations popped up all over the country! We opened our doors in London, Ontario, the University District in Calgary (featuring a massive two-story patio!), Victoria (featuring a batting cage and bowling alley!) and Banff, Alberta. We also opened The Canadian Icehouse in Edmonton's ICE District, a one-of-a-kind elevated sports bar and lounge with the largest rooftop patio in Western Canada! 2024 2024 was another year of growth! We opened our new Kamloops location in August, and our Kitchener location in September. More to come in 2025! 2025 We started 2025 strong, opening our new Mississauga location in January ‚Äî and we‚Äôve kept the momentum going. In May, we proudly opened our 47th and 48th locations in Prince Albert and Windsor. Stay tuned for more updates as we continue to grow! The Canadian Brewhouse Corporate Office: 780-469-5126‚Äã 1112 ‚Äì 95 Street SW ‚ÄãEdmonton, AB ‚ÄãT6X 0A7 Click here to view our response to Canada‚Äôs Modern Slavery Act, including our Supplier Code of Conduct and Fair Labour Practices. Mediterranean & American Cuisine | Local Breweries Near Me Skip to content About Our Story Our Team Our Mission Code Of Conduct On Tap Our Beer Food LALA St. Pete Menu Community Brew good SUSTAINABILITY Visit TAPROOM BEER GARDEN STAMMTISCH TERRACE Events Private Events Book An Event Contact About Our Story Our Team Our Mission Code Of Conduct On Tap Our Beer Food LALA St. Pete Menu Community Brew good SUSTAINABILITY Visit TAPROOM BEER GARDEN STAMMTISCH TERRACE Events Private Events Book An Event Contact Facebook Instagram Brewery, Taproom and Beer Garden in St. Petersburg, FL FOOD Savor & Sip: The Ultimate Food Experience at Grand Central Brewhouse Searching for the best breweries near me that combine top-tier craft beers with mouthwatering food? Grand Central Brewhouse delivers just that. Here, Mediterranean-inspired dishes meet elevated pub fare, creating a perfect pairing for your craft beer experience. Elevated Pub Fare Meets Mediterranean Flavors At Grand Central Brewhouse, we believe dining should be as enjoyable as the beer you drink. LALA St. Pete, located across the beer garden, serves up a diverse menu blending Mediterranean flavors with classic American pub favorites. From zesty salads to hearty burgers, each dish is freshly prepared using high-quality ingredients. Whether you crave a Mediterranean platter or a comforting pub staple, our food pairs beautifully with the variety of craft beers on tap. With options for all tastes, our brewery provides the ideal setting for both casual meetups and more refined dining experiences. Brewery Menu with a Twist We make ordering food easy at Grand Central Brewhouse. You can order directly from our friendly beertenders or scan the QR code at your table for quick online ordering. Once you order, sit back and relax while we deliver your meal right to your table. Pair your dish with one of our signature craft beers, brewed on-site to enhance your experience. As one of the top breweries near me, Grand Central Brewhouse offers an atmosphere where great food and exceptional craft beer come together. Come for the craft beers, stay for the food, and leave with an unforgettable experience at Grand Central Brewhouse. We guarantee you‚Äôll enjoy the perfect blend of flavors and vibes that only our brewery can deliver. Join us on Sunday, September 7 at 5 PM when The Sundaes take the stage for a Sunday night set you won‚Äôt want to miss. If you could piece together a supergroup whose harmonies could stretch the weekend just a little longer, this would be it. Each member brings their own talent and energy, coming together to create a sound that feels equal parts timeless and feel-good. Come hang. 10 1 Open post by grandcentralbrewhouse with ID 18020757095751390 10 1 Speak Easy returns to GCB On September 6th at 7PM with their signature blend of groove-heavy rhythm, catchy lyrics, and high-energy performance. Since forming at USFSP in 2017, they‚Äôve become a staple of the St. Pete music scene and have played stages across Florida including Gasparilla Music Fest, Clearwater Jazz Fest, and the Floridian Social Club. Expect electric guitar solos, tight harmonies, and a sound that‚Äôs sure to move a crowd. 14 0 Open post by grandcentralbrewhouse with ID 18049245218298443 14 0 SkaFest Vol. 3 was an absolute blast. Thanks to everyone who came out to dance, drink, and make it another unforgettable day. Our SkaFest shirts went fast this year and we‚Äôre already down to fewer than 20 left. Mediums are sold out, but we still have a handful of Smalls, plus L, XL, and 2XL. If you missed grabbing one at the festival, now‚Äôs the time to stop by and pick one up before they‚Äôre gone. 46 3 Open post by grandcentralbrewhouse with ID 18075631139018210 46 3 Pinellas Run Club meets tonight (September 4th) at 6 PM right here at the brewery. After a quick overview, runners and walkers head out for a their chosen distance route. After the run enjoy $2 off GCB beers. It‚Äôs one of the biggest run clubs in the area and always a great time. 27 0 Open post by grandcentralbrewhouse with ID 17847367746556737 27 0 On Friday, September 5 at 6 PM Crisis the Jazz Project returns to GCB! If you haven‚Äôt heard of them before, they are a jazz project featuring members of well-known Tampa Bay bands stepping outside their usual sound. Blending their backgrounds into something unexpected, this group brings a fresh take on jazz with familiar faces in less familiar territory. Catch them live and see what happens when musicians push past the edges of their genre. 11 0 Open post by grandcentralbrewhouse with ID 17999308943656733 11 0 Our latest collaboration with @pointybelbrew, Rice Rice Baby, is a clean and refreshing rice lager brewed with Riverbend Pilsner malt and jasmine rice. The rice lends a delicate floral aroma and a subtle sweetness that lightens the body while keeping the finish crisp and dry. Perle and Saaz hops add gentle spice and a touch of herbal character that complement the malt and rice without overpowering them. The result is a bright lager with notes of toasted baguette and fragrant jasmine blossom, culminating in a clean, refreshing close. At 4.5% ABV, this lager shows that true complexity can be found in simplicity. Rice Rice Baby is on tap now, and we`ll also be pouring it today, Sunday August 31, at the Cool & Crispy Festival at Point Ybel Brewing. Stop by and grab a glass! 33 2 Open post by grandcentralbrewhouse with ID 18057786497113047 33 2 On Sunday, August 31 at 2 PM The Fernando Cruz Trio returns to Grand Central Brewhouse for an afternoon of rich, expressive jazz led by saxophonist, composer, and educator Fernando Cruz. A standout in the Florida music scene, Fernando brings a deep, soulful energy to the stage inspired by legends like Coltrane, Rollins, and Parker. Join us for a performance that blends technical mastery with heartfelt improvisation. 8 0 Open post by grandcentralbrewhouse with ID 18491141893069259 8 0 Today‚Äôs the day! SkaFest Vol. 3: Lager‚Äôs Not Dead kicks off at 1 PM. We‚Äôve got seven bands lined up to keep the music rolling all day long, fresh lagers pouring nonstop, and some great vendors joining the party. Music starts at 1 PM and runs through the night. Grab your crew, lace up those dancing shoes, and get ready to skank the day away with us! 41 3 Open post by grandcentralbrewhouse with ID 17917168335157232 41 3 SkaFest is back this Saturday! Lager‚Äôs Not Dead: SkaFest Vol. 3 hits Grand Central Brewhouse on Saturday, August 30 from 1 PM to 10 PM, and it‚Äôs shaping up to be one of the best yet. The lineup: üí• Eric Best ‚Äì 1 PM - 1:45PM üí• Over Wait Mammal ‚Äì 2 PM - 2:45 PM üí• Saganaki Bomb Squad ‚Äì 3 PM - 3:45 PM üí• Chilled Monkey Brains ‚Äì 4 PM - 5 PM üí• Floridaze ‚Äì 5:15 PM - 6:30 PM üí• Control This! ‚Äì 6:45 PM - 7:45 PM üí• Victims of Circumstance ‚Äì 8 PM - 9:45 PM We‚Äôll have a wide array of fresh lagers pouring all day, a misting tent to keep you cool, and vendors like JB‚Äôs Hot Dogs, Churned Ice Cream, and Planet Retro hanging out for the day. This event takes place in the Beer Garden and will be held rain or shine. We have plenty of tent coverage set up for the occasion. *Performance times are subject to change. See you at SkaFest! 38 0 Open post by grandcentralbrewhouse with ID 17981312699736682 38 0 On Friday, August 29 at 6 PM Ultra Vinyl takes the stage with a set full of hits from across the decades. This Tampa Bay-based cover band brings a polished, high-energy performance that‚Äôs perfect for fans of live music you know and love. Whether you‚Äôre here to dance or just enjoy a great show with a beer in hand, Ultra Vinyl delivers the soundtrack. 5 0 Open post by grandcentralbrewhouse with ID 18058524002105109 5 0 21 2 Open post by grandcentralbrewhouse with ID 17853359745469320 21 2 On Saturday, August 23 at 6 PM The Rich Sheldon Band brings their blend of soulful Americana, folk, and roots rock to Grand Central Brewhouse. With influences ranging from the Grateful Dead and Bob Marley to Dylan and The Beatles, Rich and his band deliver a mix of original tunes, bluesy ballads, and jam-worthy covers that feel timeless. 7 0 Open post by grandcentralbrewhouse with ID 17975079755875857 7 0 Load More SIGN UP FOR THE BREWHOUSE BULLETIN Email Subscribe Address 2340 Central Ave. St. Petersburg, FL 33712 Hours Sun - Wed: 12pm - 10pm Thurs: 12pm - 11pm Fri - Sat: 12pm - 12am *After 9pm: 21 & Up Only GET IN TOUCH (727) 202-6071 [email¬†protected] Share your experience Facebook Instagram Yelp BLog Employee Portal ¬© Grand Central Brewhouse, St. Petersburg, FL | Privacy Policy | Powered & Designed by Brewing Sites Home About On Tap Our Beer Food Community Visit Events Private Events Contact Home About On Tap Our Beer Food Community Visit Events Private Events Contact Facebook Instagram

Grand Central Brewhouse brings jobs, philanthropy ‚Äî and great beer ‚Äî to St. Petersburg ‚Ä¢ St Pete Catalyst ST Pete's Business Daily (and a whole lot more) sign up for a free lifetime subscription And take your seat at the table Name Email Subscribe News Know Innovate Thrive Create Place Impact Venture Content SPG Insight Partner Stories Podcasts People Influencers The Hustle The Shuffle Organizations Connect Contribute Content Promote Your Business Meet the Team Support the Catalyst Events Community Voices Connect with us Type a text St Pete Catalyst News Know Innovate Thrive Create Place Impact Venture Content SPG Insight Partner Stories Podcasts People Influencers The Hustle The Shuffle Organizations Connect Contribute Content Promote Your Business Meet the Team Support the Catalyst Events Community Voices Impact Grand Central Brewhouse brings jobs, philanthropy ‚Äî and great beer ‚Äî to St. Petersburg Published 5 years ago on December 10, 2020 By Margie Manning Kevin Milkey, founder and CEO, Grand Central Brewhouse Kevin Milkey drew on his experiences at brew pubs around the world when he created Grand Central Brewhouse. The Brewhouse has copper serving kegs that are popular in Prague and other European cities, pulley fans that resemble those Milkey saw at an old bar in New York City, and a Bavarian-style beer garden. ‚ÄúThere are so many influences here that came from my travels with my wife Jeanne. Some of it was before I thought about starting a brewery and some since I had the idea, even when construction was ongoing. I wanted to create a brewery that had what I thought were all the best features I liked,‚Äù Milkey, founder and CEO, told the St. Pete Catalyst . The Catalyst got a sneak peek as Grand Central Brewhouse, at 2324 Central Ave., prepares for its grand opening this weekend, just over a year after groundbreaking . Milkey has invested about $5 million in the project, which includes two newly constructed buildings totaling more than 10,000 square feet on land he acquired about two years ago. Place Architecture was the architect on the project and Boyd Construction handled the buildout. The site previously was home to Taco Bus and long before that, a Cadillac dealership. Grand Central Brewhouse occupies the building on the right. LaLa St. Pete, a restaurant, will occupy the building on the left. The Brewhouse not only adds to the flourishing activity in the Grand Central District, but also will have an economic impact. Milkey has hired 22 people ‚Äî a dozen full-time and 10 part-time ‚Äî nearly all of whom had lost their jobs or had their hours cut when other local restaurants and breweries limited their operations due to the Covid-19 pandemic. In addition, Milkey, a retired insurance executive and philanthropist, will donate 10 percent of the sales of selected beers to nonprofit organizations. Related: Why this philanthropist gives back to St. Pete ‚ÄúWe will always have three beers on tap that are charity beers. It‚Äôs part of our ‚ÄòBrew Good‚Äô program. Ten percent of sales from these¬† beers will go to three local nonprofits,‚Äù Milkey said. ‚ÄúYou buy a $6 beer and 60 cents is going to charity.‚Äù Tampa Bay Watch, dedicated to the preservation and restoration of the Tampa Bay estuary, will receive 10 percent of the sales from the beer of the day on a permanent basis. Milkey and his family are long-time supporters of Tampa Bay Watch. The other two nonprofits will rotate monthly, with Milkey selecting one and the Brewhouse staff selecting the other. Initially, Daystar Life Center and The Manners House are the other recipients. Lagers and ales The brewery is a 10-barrel system, equivalent to 20 kegs of beer for each brewing cycle. The brewery at Grand Central Brewhouse ‚ÄúWe have four fermenters. We can we brew four beers four days in a row and put them in the four fermenters, where they have to stay for at least 10 days and often 14 days. Then we can do another batch,‚Äù Milkey said. The head brewer is Tyler Singletary, a veteran of the local craft brewing industry. The Brewhouse will have both lagers ‚Äî which tend to have a crisper, cleaner taste, according to Tapville ‚Äî and ales, which are more full-bodied and sweeter. ‚ÄúI told Tyler I wanted more lagers, the more easy-drinking, traditional style of beer that most people like. It‚Äôs hot in Florida and people want something that‚Äôs smoother and crisp. But we‚Äôll have a full spectrum of beers, a few IPAs, every shade of ale, in addition to the lagers,‚Äù Milkey said. A unique feature at the Brewhouse are the copper serving tanks. Copper serving tanks over the first floor bar While they are popular in Europe, they are made by a company in Missouri, from which Milkey ordered them. The copper tanks keep beer fresher because there‚Äôs no need to add carbon dioxide as the beer gets lower in the tank. The brewhouse features an observation window on the second floor so guests can watch the brewing process in action. The brewery as seen from the second floor observation window. There‚Äôs also a laboratory. ‚ÄúWe take quality extremely seriously. To make sure you are measuring quality right, you need a lab,‚Äù Milkey said. The laboratory The Brewhouse also will offer four wines on tap ‚Äì two reds and two whites ‚Äì and free self-serve purified sparkling and still water. Milkey expects to add coffee later. Safety steps Inside the Brewhouse, there‚Äôs an industrial feel, with steel and brick and concrete floors. Windows facing Central Avenue are actually doors that open up, similar to a garage door. Windows facing Central Avenue can be opened like garage doors The upstairs, including an outside terrace, feels more like a lounge. Milkey expects it to be a popular spot for private parties. The second floor of Grand Central Brewhouse A counter facing Central Avenue on the second floor is one of Milkey‚Äôs favorite spot in the Brewhouse. View of Central Avenue from the second floor The beer garden includes lots of seating, with room for bocce ball and cornhole games. Milkey plans to show movies and sports on a screen painted on the eastern wall. The beer garden includes an olive tree to provide shade. The walls facing the beer garden feature murals by local artist Carrie Jadus and are among the several murals at the Brewhouse. The mural on the outside west wall was painted by Jabari Reed, who goes by iBombs, and was created as part of the SHINE Mural Festival to depict the impact of red tide on the ocean. Mural by Jabari Reed, aka iBomb The Brewhouse has a total capacity of 600, most of that outside in the beer garden and upstairs terrace. When it opens, and through the pandemic, Milkey said he will limit the amount of people to no more than 50 percent of capacity. All employees wear masks, there are lots of hand sanitizer stations and a professional crew will come in nightly to clean and sanitize. The Brewhouse is in the western part of the two-building project. LaLa Karaoke Box, or LaLa St. Pete, will occupy the eastern half of the site . The restaurant concept features high-end pub food with a French twist and seven private karaoke rooms. When it opens in May, it will provide food to Grand Central Brewhouse. Until then, Milkey plans to bring some food trucks to the Brewhouse occasionally, in partnership with his neighbor, The Dog Bar, and guests can bring in their own food. ‚ÄúIf they don‚Äôt have food they are here for one or two drinks and then they need to go get something to eat,‚Äù Milkey said. ‚ÄúIf they have food they stay.‚Äù Still to come are solar panels on the roof of the Brewhouse that will take care of 40 percent to 50 percent of its electric needs, Milkey said. Grand Central Brewhouse is your go-to destination for unforgettable brewery events. From corporate gatherings to personal celebrations, our craft beer brewery offers exceptional spaces that cater to all your needs. Private Event Spaces Elevate your event with our unique spaces designed to make every gathering special. Stammtisch Room This intimate setting is ideal for cozy gatherings, providing a warm atmosphere and a curated craft beer experience. Whether you‚Äôre hosting a small team meeting or a personal celebration, the Stammtisch Room creates an inviting and memorable environment. Enjoy the vibrant atmosphere of our craft beer brewery while making the most of this open-air setting. We handle the rest, ensuring that your brewery event is tailored to your needs and runs smoothly. Why Choose Us? Our craft beer brewery isn‚Äôt just about great beer‚Äîit‚Äôs about creating memorable experiences. Whether you‚Äôre celebrating a milestone or organizing a corporate function, Grand Central Brewhouse offers the ideal backdrop for your brewery events. Enjoy exceptional spaces, personalized service, and, of course, outstanding craft beers. Conceived by local restaurateur Lucas Herraiz, owner of Tikanis on Bay Pines Blvd., their menu will feature an elevated approach to American craft fare with French influences. The food will range from wings with house-made sauces and home made brick oven pizza to an assortment of appetizers, salads, handhelds, and entrees such beef bourguignon. A full menu of craft cocktails, wine, and GCB beer will also be available. In addition to a large general seating area that includes a rooftop bar and two outdoor terraces, LALA will have seven private karaoke rooms, or ‚Äúkaraoke boxes‚Äù. Ranging in size and theme, each room will have proprietary karaoke machines with a large catalogue of songs. In between your favorite ballads, you can order food and beverages to keep the party going. Grand Central Brewhouse patrons will also be able to order LALA food, enjoying the benefits of a brew pub within the casual atmosphere of our taproom and beer garden. The menu will feature recommended beer pairings for the optimal flavor experience and select dishes will be made with GCB brew. Learn more about the founder of LALA and all the restaurant offerings in this article by St. Pete Rising . return to news Join us on Sunday, September 7 at 5 PM when The Sundaes take the stage for a Sunday night set you won‚Äôt want to miss. His passion and expertise drive the success of our craft beer brewery. After retiring from a successful career in insurance, Kevin has decided to take his talents to the craft beer industry. Exactly what those talents are remains debatable. But what is not debatable is his love of beer and spending time at craft breweries. Prior to establishing Grand Central Brewhouse, Kevin was one of the three original employees at American Strategic Insurance, more commonly known as ASI, a property insurance company based in St. Petersburg. After 21 years at ASI and following the acquisition of ASI by Progressive Insurance Group, Kevin retired from ASI. But long before he retired, he dreamt of owning a craft brewery someday. Kevin was an early enthusiast of craft beers, long before most people had heard of craft beers or microbrews. Before any craft breweries opened locally, Kevin regularly stopped into Shep‚Äôs on Fourth Street to pick up new craft beer to sample from around the country. Kevin, his wife Jeanne, and son Jack love to travel and craft breweries, pubs, beer halls, and beer tours became a significant part of the itinerary wherever they traveled in both the U.S. and Europe. The laid-back environment and large variety of innovative beers at craft breweries presented the ideal combination to spend quality time. In recent years, the brewery stops have become ‚Äúresearch‚Äù trips. Kevin has incorporated many ideas from breweries and pubs from around the world into his vision for Grand Central Brewhouse, most notably serving beer directly from serving tanks. Kevin has also completed the Brewing Arts Program offered by USF St. Petersburg where he not only learned how to brew beer but gained foundational knowledge of owning and operating a brewery. Kevin moved to Florida from New York City in 1991 and quickly fell in love with the Tampa Bay area. Away from the brewery, Kevin is very active in the community, sitting on two charitable boards and supporting several local non-profits through the Milkey Family Foundation he established with Jeanne to support local charities in the St. Petersburg area. He is a huge sports fan and enthusiastically supports our Tampa Bay professional teams. His deep passion for bonsai artistry has earned him widespread recognition and respect in the bonsai community. Larry has displayed his trees at the EPCOT International Flower & Garden Festival for three consecutive years, showcasing his skill. He has participated in various national bonsai exhibitions, where his work has been celebrated for its artistic quality and technical execution. As the owner of Thunderstruck Bonsai, Larry has built a thriving business dedicated to nurturing and cultivating premium bonsai specimens. He is deeply committed to fostering a strong sense of community through education and consultation on bonsai care. Larry actively engages with the community through workshops and educational events, teaching enthusiasts and newcomers about the artistry and techniques of bonsai. In addition to his impressive achievements, Larry serves as the Vice President of the Suncoast Bonsai Society and is a member of the BSF Epcot Committee. He is also a dedicated student of renowned bonsai artist Nacho Marin, further enhancing his expertise and artistry. About Craft Brewery in St. Petersburg, FL Skip to content About Our Story Our Team Our Mission Code Of Conduct On Tap Our Beer Food LALA St. Pete Menu Community Brew good SUSTAINABILITY Visit TAPROOM BEER GARDEN STAMMTISCH TERRACE Events Private Events Book An Event Contact About Our Story Our Team Our Mission Code Of Conduct On Tap Our Beer Food LALA St. Pete Menu Community Brew good SUSTAINABILITY Visit TAPROOM BEER GARDEN STAMMTISCH TERRACE Events Private Events Book An Event Contact Facebook Instagram Brewery, Taproom and Beer Garden in St. Petersburg, FL Grand Central Brewhouse Overview Grand Central Brewhouse is a cornerstone of St. Pete‚Äôs Grand Central District, offering specialty craft beers and a community-focused environment. The brewery is known for its quality lagers and ales, welcoming spaces, and engaging local events. History and Philosophy Located in St. Petersburg, Florida, Grand Central Brewhouse was established to foster community and craft high-quality beers. It operates on a philosophy of giving back, donating a portion of proceeds to local charities. The emphasis is on tradition and quality ingredients, ensuring that every beer honors its roots. The two-story establishment features a taproom and beer garden, making it an inviting space for all. Brewing Process and Techniques Grand Central Brewhouse takes pride in its meticulous brewing process. Using time-honored ingredients, the brewery offers a range of artisanal lagers. European serving tank technology ensures each beer‚Äôs distinct flavors are perfectly preserved from tank to glass. From golden and crisp to dark and malty, their beers cater to diverse tastes. The emphasis on quality is evident in every aspect, right down to the thoughtfully selected glassware. Location and Community Situated steps away from Central Avenue, the brewery provides an urban retreat with expansive indoor and outdoor spaces. The dog-friendly environment encourages bonding and memory-making among visitors. Food from LALA St. Pete complements the beer experience. The venue also offers options for private events, making it a versatile space for community gatherings. GCB‚Äôs origins stem from a simple love of beer and craft breweries.¬† After many years in the insurance business, Owner and Founder Kevin Milkey wanted to establish a new craft brewery in the community he feels very passionate about.¬† The initial plan was to follow the path of most US craft breweries and convert an old warehouse, gas station, garage, or factory into a brewery, but then Kevin came across a large vacant lot for sale on Central Avenue in the heart of the Grand Central District and thought that was a perfect location for a new brewery. ¬† While discussing initial architectural plans with architect Tim Clemmons, we determined that the lot was big enough for two buildings, the second of which could be a restaurant which would provide food service for the brewery customers. So, what started out as an idea to renovate an old building into a small brewery became a new construction project with not one, but two buildings, each with a second floor and terrace and a large beer garden out back. Long before GCB opened, breweries and pubs were a frequent destination when
traveling. Many ideas incorporated into Grand Central Brewhouse came from
visits to breweries and pubs from around the world. The most notable being
serving beer directly from serving tanks, which is more common in Europe
than in the US. The shiny copper serving tanks suspended above the main bar
is the first thing your eyes are drawn to when entering GCB. In addition to
the design features of the brewery, our story is not complete without
mentioning the emphasis of employees and giving back to the community. The
goal was to establish a new brewery with a focus on the employees, with an
emphasis on fair pay, employee well-being and quality of life. Employees
are the heart of any business, and it‚Äôs of utmost importance that everyone
is treated fairly and with respect in a work environment where people are
happy at work. Lastly, sustainability and giving back to the community are
ingrained in our culture. Additional information about our community
initiatives and sustainability can be found in the Community section of
this website. OUR TEAM Inside Look: The Grand Central Brewhouse Story Grand Central Brewhouse (GCB) combines a passion for craft beer with innovative brewing techniques and community-focused initiatives. Discover how GCB‚Äôs collaborative team, mission-driven approach, commitment to sustainability, and strong code of conduct make it a standout in the craft beer industry. Kevin Milkey Founder and CEO After retiring from a successful career in insurance, Kevin has decided to take his talents to the craft beer industry. Exactly what those talents are remains debatable. But what is not debatable is his love of beer and spending time at craft breweries. Prior to establishing Grand Central Brewhouse, Kevin was one of the three original employees at American Strategic Insurance, more commonly known as ASI, a property insurance company based in St. Petersburg. After 21 years at ASI and following the acquisition of ASI by Progressive Insurance Group, Kevin retired from ASI. But long before he retired, he dreamt of owning a craft brewery someday. Kevin was an early enthusiast of craft beers, long before most people had heard of craft beers or microbrews. Before any craft breweries opened locally, Kevin regularly stopped into Shep‚Äôs on Fourth Street to pick up new craft beer to sample from around the country. Kevin, his wife Jeanne, and son Jack love to travel and craft breweries, pubs, beer halls, and beer tours became a significant part of the itinerary wherever they traveled in both the U.S. and Europe. The laid-back environment and large variety of innovative beers at craft breweries presented the ideal combination to spend quality time. In recent years, the brewery stops have become ‚Äúresearch‚Äù trips. Kevin has incorporated many ideas from breweries and pubs from around the world into his vision for Grand Central Brewhouse, most notably serving beer directly from serving tanks. Kevin has also completed the Brewing Arts Program offered by USF St. Petersburg where he not only learned how to brew beer but gained foundational knowledge of owning and operating a brewery. Kevin moved to Florida from New York City in 1991 and quickly fell in love with the Tampa Bay area. Away from the brewery, Kevin is very active in the community, sitting on two charitable boards and supporting several local non-profits through the Milkey Family Foundation he established with Jeanne to support local charities in the St. Petersburg area. He is a huge sports fan and enthusiastically supports our Tampa Bay professional teams. An avid runner, Kevin has completed 11 marathons, which helps complement his other passion, beer. Zac Collins Head Brewer Zac has been at GCB since opening day.  Here‚Äôs a little background in his own words: ‚ÄùAs far back as I can remember, I always wanted to be a brewer. I‚Äôve always been a fan of craft beer, along with other luxury intoxicants, but I haven‚Äôt always been able to afford them so like any enterprising young gentleman I found a way to get my beers for free. I brewed at St. Pete Brewing Co. and then Arkane Aleworks and now I brew at Grand Central Brewhouse. I always get asked the same questions so I‚Äôll just answer them here; yes, my job is cooler than yours. Yes, I graduated law school and yes, you can find Joe Scribbleshoots modeling pictures online.‚Äù Matthew O‚ÄôConnell General Manager Matt joined the Grand Central Brewhouse team as our General Manager in July 2021. His love for craft beer began while attending Florida State University. While earning his degrees in Entrepreneurship and Business Management, he also took on a Beverage Sciences minor through the school of Hospitality. The classes themselves taught about wine, beer, spirits, and other beverages (Juices, Coffee, Tea) but it was ‚ÄúAles and Lagers of the World‚Äù that changed his entire career path. Matt learned about the world‚Äôs many beer drinking regions and the styles that they developed, malting, brewing horticulture, the fermentation process and the distribution chain, but actually getting to drink beer in class and discover the different flavor profiles is what got him obsessed. After class, he used to go to Proof Beer Bar (Before it was a brewery) so that he could further his ‚Äúresearch‚Äù and also collect the sweet glassware from their brewery giveaways. He became so focused on beer his parents bought him a homebrew recipes book that Christmas and started gathering equipment to brew his very first batch. After college, Matt moved to Boston, Massachusetts in 2012 and got hired at Harpoon Brewery as a Beer Hall Captain, tending bar, giving tours, selling merchandise and working festivals. After 2 years of city life and 2 of the worst winters on record, Matt headed for greener pastures and warmer weather in Saint Petersburg. He immediately got hired at the new Green Bench Brewing Company in the fall of 2014 and started out as a bartender. Over the next seven years, Matt worked his way through the front of the house, from shift lead, to cider and mead assistant, then event coordinator and finally, General Manager. Along the way he gained extensive knowledge of barrel aging and foeders, wild yeast and mixed culture fermentation, cider and mead production, and an appreciation for lager. He also made some lifelong friends along the way. During the Pandemic, Matt contemplated a new career path due to all the uncertainty surrounding the Craft Beer Industry and his own fears of burnout. It was then that he got a text from now Head Brewer Zac Collins asking if he was interested in a new role. After two meetings and day to think it over, Matt decided to keep his love of beer alive and join the Grand Central crew to continue his passion for lagers. When Matt isn‚Äôt pouring beers, fixing something around our tasting room or swinging off a ladder changing lightbulbs or hanging decorations, he likes to spend his free time with his beautiful wife Chelsy and their son Aidan. He enjoys traveling, food, video games, dogs, and fishing. Stacy Maynard Event Planner Stacy has been beertending at Grand Central Brewhouse since day one. With no previous beertending experience she was equally excited and nervous to share her talents in the craft beer scene and learn more about the beer she enjoys. Her only knowledge of craft beer at this point was based off of informal lessons from friends in the beer industry, specifically at Hops and Props. Stacy continued to work full time at Bank OZK, looking at the brewery job as something fun to do on the side. Stacy quickly became one of the many staff members at GCB who is Cicerone Certified. Stacy later learned of a position opening at Grand Central Brewhouse for an event planner for public events, which she graciously accepted. She had always thought an event planner role would be fun and more suiting to her personality but wasn‚Äôt sure it was in the cards considering her banking and finance background. She was leaving an over 15 year career in banking. Stacy quickly realized this career change was the right move and not long after was asked to take on the private events at GCB as well. Stacy moved to Tampa Bay at the age of 11 with her family from Trinidad and Tobago and has loved everything Tampa Bay ever since. Outside of the brewery, Stacy is an active volunteer in the community, and with her church. Stacy is a member of the Pink Boots Society and recently attended her first of many Craft Brewers Conferences. She is a huge Green Bay Packers fan, though tries to support the Bucs as much as she can. Though no formal accomplishments, she enjoys rollerblading and biking often. Eric Trinosky Brewer Eric joined GCB in March 2022 and this is his story: ‚ÄúSome years ago‚Äînever mind how long precisely‚Äîhaving little or no money in my purse, and nothing particular to interest me in my current profession, I thought I would give home brewing a try and see what might lay in store for me.  It has now become a way I have of driving off the spleen and regulating the circulation. Working for the last 12 years in the brewing industry, refining my skills and techniques, has culminated in my employment here at Grand Central. I was born in a small town in Central Indiana And I can breathe in that small town Gonna die in a small town Oh, and that‚Äôs probably where they‚Äôll bury me.‚Äù Teamwork Makes the Dream Work: The Collaborative Efforts at Grand Central Brewhouse At GCB, collaboration is key. This passion project began with Kevin Milkey, a former insurance professional turned brewery owner. His vision brought together an experienced team, including brewers Zac Collins and Eric Trinoskey and General Manager Matt O‚ÄôConnell. Zac and Eric‚Äôs brewing expertise blend well with Matt‚Äôs extensive experience in craft beer operations and event management. The team at GCB shares ideas and draws inspiration from global brewery visits. A notable feature is serving beer directly from copper serving tanks, a European tradition. This collaborative spirit ensures GCB offers a unique, high-quality experience that sets it apart. MISSION Taste the Difference: Grand Central Brewhouse's Mission in Action GCB‚Äôs mission is evident in every pint. Kevin Milkey‚Äôs dedication to craft beer, developed over years of global travel and study, informs the brewery‚Äôs approach. Whether it‚Äôs an IPA, Lager, Ale, or Sour, each brew aims to deliver distinct flavor profiles to delight your palate. The focus isn‚Äôt just on brewing; it‚Äôs on creating an experience that showcases the richness and diversity of craft beer.
Serving beer from copper tanks emphasizes freshness and quality, enhancing your tasting experience. This detail underscores GCB‚Äôs commitment to bringing innovative brewing techniques to the local community. Grand Central Brewhouse was designed to be an integral part of the community; a comfortable neighborhood meeting place, with a variety of indoor and outdoor spaces, highlighted by a large beer garden, from which to relax and enjoy a craft beer with friends and family.¬† People are the heart of this city and therefore, the heart of our mission. Grand Central Brewhouse will be a spot for the community to come together, make memories, and taste quality, craft beer. A place for beer enthusiasts and casual consumers alike, Grand Central Brewhouse‚Äôs drink menu features a wide variety of lagers and a full range of ales using the highest quality ingredients available.¬† Lagers are very under-represented in the craft beer arena, but most beer drinkers prefer lagers, especially on a warm Florida day. So, we will fill the void with a nice selection of light, amber and darker lagers.¬† Our Ales will include pale ales, IPAs and darker ales such as porters and stouts, wheat beers, plus some funky and sour beers. ¬† Quality and drinkability will be of utmost importance. The Triple Bottom Line Grand Central Brewhouse's Recipe for Success GCB‚Äôs success is built on three pillars: people, planet, and profit. Fair wages and a positive work environment are priorities, reflecting a deep commitment to employee well-being. Sustainability is equally important; GCB integrates eco-friendly practices into daily operations to minimize environmental impact. Community engagement is another cornerstone. Through the Brew Good program, GCB supports local non-profits, contributing to the broader St. Petersburg community. This holistic approach not only defines GCB‚Äôs business model but ensures that every pint poured positively impacts more than just your taste buds. Grand Central Brewhouse will be a Triple Bottom Line business.  Of utmost importance to our mission is our goal of Sustainability by equally emphasizing Social and Environmental concerns as well Economic, also known as the three P‚Äôs: People, Planet and Profit.  We will measure our success based on our impact on our community and positive impact on the environment in addition to traditional profit margins. For the People/Social Equity bottom line, we will emphasize fair pay, employee well-being and quality of life in addition to giving back to our community. For the Planet/Environmental bottom line, we strive to be stewards of the environment by continually reducing our carbon footprint by utilizing solar power, sky lights and other green building practices in addition to reducing toxins and waste as well as developing water conservation practices. Regarding Profit, to be a successful sustainable organization, the company must be profitable.  Profit is necessary for creating employment, spurring innovation and it plays an integral part in meeting our social and environmental goals. Code Of Conduct Brews and Behavior: How to Stay in Line with Grand Central Brewhouse's Code of Conduct GCB maintains a strong code of conduct rooted in respect, inclusivity, and community focus. This isn‚Äôt just about brewing great beer‚Äîit‚Äôs about fostering a welcoming environment. Employees and patrons alike are expected to uphold these values, ensuring everyone enjoys their time at the brewery. Kevin emphasizes the importance of fair treatment and respect for all, creating a positive atmosphere. This commitment to integrity and quality makes GCB not only a great place to enjoy craft beer but a respectful, welcoming community hub. The following Code of Conduct applies to all: Employees, Customers (taproom, private events, on-line, social media), Accounts, Vendors, Partners, Collaborators, and Contractors. All Grand Central Brewhouse employees are expected to know and follow the Code of Conduct. Failure to do so may result in disciplinary action, up to and including termination of employment. Values and Expected Behavior At Grand Central Brewhouse (GCB) we value honesty, integrity, and fairness. We believe in everyone‚Äôs right to celebrate, work, relax, and come together to enjoy craft beer in a safe, welcoming environment. Any acts of abuse, homophobia, misogyny, racism, or sexism will not be tolerated. GCB employees are expected to do their utmost to create a supportive work environment, where everyone has the opportunity to reach their fullest potential, and be free from harassment, intimidation, bias, and unlawful discrimination. Our core values are strengthened when every person has a voice and is encouraged to contribute. Equity, diversity, inclusion, and anti-racism are an active process that requires continuous commitment to accomplish our mission. Unacceptable Behaviors GCB is committed to a workplace free of harassment , bullying , discrimination , and retaliation . We define these acts clearly; harassment is the act of systematic and/or continued unwanted and annoying actions of one party or group, including threats and demands. Harassment can be any action verbal, visual, or physical that denigrates or shows hostility or aversion towards an individual because of any protected characteristic. Bullying is an ongoing and deliberate misuse of power in relationships through repeated verbal, physical, and/or social behavior that intends to cause physical, social, and/or psychological harm. Discrimination is treating a party differently or denying or granting a benefit to an individual because of the individual‚Äôs protected characteristic. Retaliation is when an individual takes negative action against another person who files a formal complaint about discrimination or harassment. Safe and Healthy Workplace We are committed to a safe, healthy, and violence-free work environment. Behavior that poses risk to the safety, health or security of GCB employees, our extended workforce, or customers is prohibited. If you become aware of a risk to the safety, health, or security of our workplace, you should report it to a manager or any owner immediately. If it is life-threatening or an emergency, call your local police, fire, or other emergency responders first, and then report it to a manager or owner. Violations of Code of Conduct Violations will be taken seriously and can result in a written warning, suspension, termination, or other consequences. Employees who repeatedly violate the Code of Conduct will be terminated. Customers who repeatedly violate the Code of Conduct will be banned. Vendors who repeatedly violate the Code of Conduct will no longer be used. Reporting Violations Any reported incidents are immediately investigated by management, and if necessary/requested, an independent party. Employees, vendors, and customers are encouraged to report violations to Kevin Milkey (Owner/CEO), at [email¬†protected] or Amie Miller (Manager), at [email¬†protected] in a manner that is most comfortable to them. This can be in-person, in-writing, and/or anonymous. You may also send an email to, [email¬†protected] .
